channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why an ethics assessment should come before a promotion
item.description: Research shows employees who engage in unethical behavior—surprisingly—are not new to their organizations. They have been there for a considerable amo...

item.title: Trump administration halts all asylum decisions and pauses issuing visas for people with Afghan passports
item.description: The Republican administration is promising to pause entry to the United States from some poor nations and review Afghans and other legal migrants alre...

item.title: Suspect in National Guard attack had been unraveling for years while alternating between ‘dark isolation and reckless travel’
item.description: Sometimes, he spent weeks in his “darkened room, not speaking to anyone, not even his wife or older kids.”

item.title: Trump says Venezuelan airspace should be viewed as closed amid largest buildup of U.S. firepower in the region in generations
item.description: The statement also said that U.S. immigration authorities had unilaterally suspended biweekly deportation flights of Venezuelan migrants.

item.title: The $124 trillion Great Wealth Transfer won’t be a ‘big bang’ warns Northwestern Mutual CEO Tim Gerend
item.description: Women live longer than men, and wealth will transfer across spouses before it moves from baby boomers to the next generation.

item.title: The World’s Best New Bourbon Has Been Crowned, and It’s Fairly Priced
What a Federal Ban on THC-Infused Drinks and Snacks Could Mean For the Hemp Industry
item.description: The hemp industry is worth $24 billion in a market where alcohol sales are plummeting.

item.title: 4 tips to help you maintain a healthy credit rating
item.description: Several years ago, a conversation about credit ratings prompted a friendly argument with an acquaintance. My friend, an idealist who hated seeing how ...

item.title: 6 Steps to Integrate AI and Automation Into Your Business Right Now
item.description: Founders who learn to work with AI and not against it will define the next decade of business.

item.title: Swiss voters reject tax of up to 50% on large donations or inheritances, fearing exodus of wealthy instead of fighting climate change
item.description: The revenues were to be used to fight the impact of climate change and help Switzerland meet its ambitions to have net-zero greenhouse gas emissions b...

item.title: Your Workers Probably Distrust AI More Than You Do, This Study Says
item.description: Overuse of AI can be risky, and your workers and best job candidates really want there to be a human in the loop.

item.title: This startup hired a sci-fi novelist to give its AI companions a soul
item.description: When Quentin Farmer was getting his startup Portola off the ground, one of the first hires he made was a sci-fi novelist. The co-founders began buildi...

item.title: 3 Ways to Establish Trust Before You Negotiate
item.description: The more time you take to establish trust, the easier, smoother, and better your negotiations will go.

item.title: How SailGP turned the niche sport into a $200 million celebrity investment magnet
item.description: This summer, Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman became co-owners of Australia’s three-time champion SailGP team. Days earlier, Anne Hathaway joined a fema...

item.title: How the Trump administration’s ‘efficiency’ goals have exacerbated food waste
item.description: The U.S. government has caused massive food waste during President Donald Trump’s second term. Policies such as immigration raids, tariff changes, and...
